title: Men against the ice
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Arctic regions - Discovery and exploration
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Arctic regions - Research
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Arctic Ocean
description: The conquest of the Artic Sea, beginning with attempts by early seafarers to thread their way through dangerous channels in search of a north-west passage across the North American Continent. Exploration by sea and air, right up to most recent developments. A forecast is made by Michael Marsden of the Artic Institute of North America. He sees the atomic-powered submarine paving the way for the industrial development of oil recourses in the Arctic.
